result.execSummary:
The defendant ALEXANDER T BERNAL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Straight time, consecutive to the sentence on Count 3 in 2021CF85 and consecutive to any other sentence.
-CASH BOND FROM 2021CF150 APPLIED. Court costs totaling $518.00 - Paid in full

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:29 PM Defendant ALEXANDER T BERNAL in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ALEXANDER T BERNAL. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 as charged in 2021CF85 with probation and count 3 as repeater with jail time; and will plea to count 1 as repeater in 2021CF150 with probation and will plea to count 1 as repeater in 2022CF4 with probation and all the other counts will be dismissed and read-in. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and 3 as charged in 2021CF85 and orders counts 2 & 4 be dismissed and read-in; in 2021CF150 court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in; in 2022CF4 Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2021CF85 (Count 1)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. Cash bond on file to be applied to the costs.
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Count 3

-120 days county jail - straight time, consecutive to 2022CF4 and consecutive to any other sentence.
-Court costs. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

2021CF150 (count 1)

Count 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. 
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
-Defendant is to pay off all the court costs in these cases, and any money that's posted for bond needs to go to pay any back child support.

2022CF4 (count 1)

-90 days county jail - straight time, consecutive to the sentence on Count 3 in 2021CF85 and consecutive to any other sentence.
-Court costs.

Sentence credit of 154 days that may cancel out 2021CF85, but the jail will do the math. If any credit left, it will be applied to the probation on 2021CF85.

Court adjourned at 2:51 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pretrial Status Report
State's
Return date on March 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:36 PM Defendant ALEXANDER T BERNAL appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for ALEXANDER T BERNAL, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states defendant will be waiving his right to a prelim. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, copy to the attorney, and it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Kapelis acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on both counts on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date March 08, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 2:39 PM.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Michael Kapelis
Second appearance on February 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:45 AM Defendant ALEXANDER T BERNAL appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $20,000 cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Statement by defendant regarding speedy trial on all cases. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on February 8, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:49 AM
